data.title: ‎‘Conquest of the Planet of the Apes’ review by George Carmi • Letterboxd
data.meta_description: idk, man. I'm sorry. These sequels just aren't for me. The commentary is so in your face it's off-putting. And I know this is intentional but it's absolutely not for me. It's important, but there are more impactful ways of getting out this message. It feels almost disrespectful how direct this film is. The hand-holding is insane... there is zero trust in the audience. Caesar could've been something wonderful but ultimately falls really flat as a character. The final few sequences were special, truly, and this franchise knows how to end a film, but that doesn't make your the first
data.text: idk, man. I'm sorry. These sequels just aren't for me. The commentary is so in your face it's off-putting. And I know this is intentional but it's absolutely not for me. It's important, but there are more impactful ways of getting out this message. It feels almost disrespectful how direct this film is. The hand-holding is insane... there is zero trust in the audience. Caesar could've been something wonderful but ultimately falls really flat as a character. The final few sequences were special, truly, and this franchise knows how to end a film, but that doesn't make your the first hour of the film that moves really poorly and feels really lazy.
